lead_paragraph: Jamaica's Asafa Powell taunted Justin Gatlin, his sprint rival, yesterday by claiming that Gatlin was trying to avoid racing against him. Powell and Gatlin hold the 100-meter world record time of 9.77 seconds, and the pair were scheduled to race at Monday's I.A.A.F. Super Grand Prix in Athens. But Gatlin withdrew with a leg injury.
